website_summaries.verdict: Budget-priced rack with an impressive capacity and reassuring stability. Best bargain available.
cons: Bikes may sway a bit while in transit
Might bend slightly under a heavy load

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: i wanted a bike rack for my 2015 scion xb and bought this 3-bike rack and the CURT 124903 Class 2, 1.25 inch hitch. Like many had stated, there is an issue with the 1.25 inch hitch after installing the rack. it does wobbles and seems very unsecured. So i did me some research and found a cheap solution - buy a u bar (cost $12, see pix)! This made the whole package completed.
customer_reviews.author: Rin.DP

customer_reviews.title: worked great until it did not.
customer_reviews.text: The warranty is junk. I was told by a representative that my F-350 suspension system is too firm for this and they would not cover the product under warranty. No where in the description/installation or warranty PDF do they say anything about one-ton trucks would void the warranty. I had also mentioned that I used it sometimes on my camper which they claim is also not covered under warranty. just be warned if you want to use this on a truck or camper its not covered (won't find it in writing)
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the rack. Looks good and assembly was easy. Has a little bit of wobble but I'm overall satisfied considering this was one of the cheaper hitch racks.
customer_reviews.author: CuyunaMike

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was fairly straightforward. If you are installing on a 1.25” like I did you’ll need an Allen wrench to remove the screw holding the adapter plate in place. Guessing the size of this wrench was the hardest job. Easy to install and remove from the hitch receiver. Easy to put the bikes on and take them off and the instructions on doing this are much more helpful than the instructions on removing the adapter plate. Easy to tighten it up in the receiver and lock in place with the key. Feels solid and holds the bikes reliably. Quite pleased with this rack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: medialint

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Using this to haul around 2 rad rover Ebikes. It does the job, but you need to have additional straps in order to securely transport any bikes with this rack, the rack has no reliable built in way to secure the bikes to the rack. The hitch mount makes me alre nervous as well, instead of a pin with cotter pin through the receiver and the hitch, it only uses pressure exerted from the inside out by expanding the bike mount inside of the hitch receiver. I haven’t had any issues with it lossening it yet, but I’ve only used it a handful of times probably 400 miles, but it still makes me nervous
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I can tell that both the product itself and the price are unbeatable. I tried it today and it holds very well, has good support and the structure is strong (you could tell by its weight) Remember something, in case you have a 2-inch hitch, once you snap the rack remember to screw the triangle hand in so the metallic plate on the opposite edge can expand and secure your rack preventing it from wobbling. Also, in order to tighten the screws, you would need a couple of wrenches, doing it by hand or with conventional tools is not gonna work.
customer_reviews.author: Filipp

customer_reviews.title: for the price it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to assemble does not have a locking feature for bikes or at hitch I bought a locking pin for the hitch for $12 at our local hardware store holds two bikes very easily Three bikes will be tight bikes can move around a little so I suggest getting some bungee chords to keep the bikes from baning into each other For the price it gets the job done. IF you own a $6000 yeti or reeb I wouldn't suggest this rack, but then again if you can afford those bikes you can afford a thule or yakima rack!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S.

customer_reviews.title: No wobble at 2” hitch receiver when installed correctly following the instruction.
customer_reviews.text: No wobble at 2” hitch receiver at all .Need to follow instruction correctly When people say there is wobble at the filler plate into the 2” receiver pitch,they did NOT pay attention to the instruction. The Bolt SHOULDER needs to be through the hitch and tightened directly against the filler plate. Once it‘s fastened,there is no wobble at all. I gave 4 star but not 5,because when the carrier arm is folded back,it rattles and make some noise by constantly hitting the lock pin. In one of the recent reviews,some one posted a short video clip showing this issue。
customer_reviews.author: Yicheng Yang

customer_reviews.title: Decent but needs work!
customer_reviews.text: There is wobble as most people have experienced. I ordered a Curt stabilizing strap to tie it back to my trunk lip which mostly solved that problem. It comes with a very long bolt / lock nut which is about 1.5 inches longer than it needs to be and takes extra time to thread it tight. The first time I used it I only went about 5 miles to the park and the straps had already loosened on their own. I have since just used a couple short lashing straps to back them up. Overall it is good for less than $100 but make sure you use bungees to secure your bike for extra safety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Geek

customer_reviews.title: Wobbdly Wobbldy Whoop .....
customer_reviews.text: Rack wobbles like no other for a 2inch hitch. IF for a 2 inch I suggest do not buy, I have no idea how this rack for so many stars, maybe people love to wobble. I for sure don't. Also the contact number for Allen sports is a third party - only to put on a waiting list to get a call from the actual company so good luck with that as well. save yourself the trouble and just don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check your hitch!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a decent rack, but since I always look at negative reviews first, I'm putting this here. If your hitch is flush with your bumper this will probably work fine, but if your hitch is tucked under your bumper a few inches (like it is on my car), that reinforcing piece will get in the way and not let you get the rack in the receiver fully. I ended up returning and getting a Curt rack, it was a little more expensive, but it holds 4 bikes and is much more heavy duty and well designed!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fleser

customer_reviews.title: Believe me it's a nice bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the reviews that day it doesn't fit right in the receiver. If it was any biggeryou wouldn't be able to get it in the receiver. Yes if you shake the rack it will wobble a little. I put the rack on my Honda Accord. I mounted 2 bikes and bungeed the wheels and drove from Pittsburgh PA to Myrtle Beach SC then to Atlanta GA and back to Pittsburgh. No problems, no excessive wobble, I didn't even know the bikes were back there. For the price you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: dimitri44

customer_reviews.title: too short for non SUV
customer_reviews.text: nice quality rack HOWEVER it is about 4 inches shorter in height than my Yakima rack. So if you use a 'bike frame adapter' that goes from your seat to stem so bike hangs level (almost a must for many mt bikes), then your bike tires are very close to the ground. As a result my bike tires drag when I enter my driveway which is at a slight slope. So I cant use the adapter. So - I would not recommend this rack unless you are using it with an SUV type vehicle. If you have an SUV than for the money it seems like a nice rack so far.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles, But!! get this hitch stabilizer and perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike rack. It’s a little wobbly and doesn’t fit into my receiver snug as much as I’d like it to. I bought this (and highly recommend!) hitch stabilizer and it’s perfect. No wobble or rattle. You can’t buy it in stores, so add it to your cart when you buy the rack. OxGord Hitch Tightener Anti-Rattle Stabilizer for 2 and 3.75 Inch Hitches - Heavy-Duty Lock Down Tow Clamp, Rust Free
customer_reviews.author: Tibor Moldovan

customer_reviews.title: Great, secure 3 bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving the security feature. I don't have to take it on and off the tow hitch. I do not like the fact that there is no metal loop in a position where I could slide the bike lock through. The bike rack is safe but the bikes can easily be removed. So there's that. I have combined two locks and slide it through the bottom metal loop. Do not buy the bar thingy that makes a girl bike easier to attach to the rack. Useless $20 item. The straps swivel so any bike can fit. Lastly, I don't like that it shakes and bounces with the bikes on it, no matter how steady you drive.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Fool proof carrier
customer_reviews.text: I especially liked the value compared to some of the top brands. I unboxed it, plugged it into receiver and I was ready to go. I have a 2018 4runner with a 2" receiver. The hitch has a built in adapter and a special link pin for the 2" receiver. It's not one of those easy in and out devices but screws in securely with a special Boots type nut. Takes some tools to get the hitch off. Very secure. I like the swing out system that is so easy to use plus the folding hitch arms on top. All in all, it's an exceptionally good hitch but might be a little tight for three bikes. Two bikes are good.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D. Alldredge

customer_reviews.title: Good product but poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: My third Allen sports bike carrier. Good rack, well placed bike holders, good looks, easy bike installation But after my second trip with bikes, the carrier won’t come off the hitch. Keys would not turn counterclockwise and I was stuck with it for over half hour. Called Allen sports customer service and asked for help, they took details but no response since 4 days. I managed to get it out later, but am I to try my luck again? Will wait if not will return. Maybe this was a defective one or a one time issue...
customer_reviews.author: MKEM6

customer_reviews.title: Allen Sports has Superb Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this bike rack last month. He has used it a couple of times, and it has worked very well at carrying 3 bicycles as designed. It feels very solid. One thing that he has found remarkable is the customer service he has received from Allen Sports. ON 2 separate occasions he has had questions for the company, and they've responded to by messages within several hours - including on a Saturday afternoon in July - which was a tremendous help. He cannot think of a time when he has had better customer service. If the product quality matches the service we've had to date, we will enjoy this bike rack for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Ruecker

customer_reviews.title: Very good rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side + solid construction + fairly stable + Easy to assemble + easy to lock + tilt back is easy and allows easy access to my rear hatchback Needs improvement - Should have a metal loop to attach bike lock & cable to - A little left / right sway, about one inch each way Other factors to help • Consider using bungee cord to keep front wheels from flying around • Consider plumbing insulation tubing (~ 2 foot each) to keep bikes from scratching each other (cheap at home depot)
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad rack
customer_reviews.text: Got the 3 bike locking rack, I've used a few times now and I like it. Feels secure and I dont worry about the bikes falling off while on the road. Only had 2 gripes about it, first is when transporting 1 bike it tends to swing. It was am easy fix, I wrapped the part of the rack that would touch a frame with athletic tape. Won't scratch the bikes now and to keep them from swaying I use kayak lashing straps. The second is the little button that engages the hitch on hole decided to fall off. Not sure how to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Loose even when following instructions
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions that were enclosed and followed their video on youtube and the rack is still extremely loose. I reached out to their customer service multiple times and all they do is point you back to the video. I had to explain that I followed all of that already and they said they would send me a replacement bolt and the bolt they sent was way too small. I contacted them again explaining the bolt they sent me was way too small and they AGAIN referred me to their youtube video. I am now wasting time trying to get this to work and it seems like others have the same problem. Poorly designed and poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Libera

customer_reviews.title: Get the lock and strap with premier
customer_reviews.text: The premier rack with lock is the way to go so spend the extra money if you can. The lock on this rack also spins so you can tighten it down making it very sturdy. I saw some reviews saying it wobbles but that’s not the case. I have a Tahoe with the 2” tow and works well. So far the straps are boss and so easy to use and bike stay firm. I just wonder how long they will last but the rubber is thick and sturdy. I don’t leave mine on and it’s easy to take off and put on. I can open the back of the Tahoe with the lean option. Very well designed rack!!!
customer_reviews.author: cassie m.

customer_reviews.title: Nice price, easy install
customer_reviews.text: Install was fast. Getting the bikes in place can be a little tricky but nothing to complain about. There's a rattle as you drive if there aren't bikes weighing down the arm. Not a problem, just annoying to hear. Due to the natural give in the joints to allow for easy folding up and down. I might have liked another tie-down system/material for the bikes. The nylon straps and plastic hooks scream flimsy, but we haven't had an issue. Also, it's easy enough to tighten the straps with one hand at a gas station if need be. Would recommend. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: aebsr

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one easy fix flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and solid frame hold 3 bikes with no problem. The tilt feature is a plus. My only complaint would be when you have it stored in the down position with no bikes on it the rack that holds the bikes rattle a bit but a small strap to hold it down and tight and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent M. Coronati

customer_reviews.title: Wooble wobble
customer_reviews.text: I use this without the 2inch adapter and it is a wobbly mess, up and down , side to side, no matter how much I tighten it. I used to have a previous version of this which didn't do this and really liked. This new version however leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: leftyRyder

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and sturdy bike rack. Easy to assemble. VERY heavy for a hitch rack, but seems to be made out of stew thicker than other normal hitch racks, so should last a long time. The hitch lock feature adds extra squeeze to the base to where it doesn’t move an inch. The only thing that moves when driving is the rack stem tilting slightly around curves. A faint “creak” can be heard when it shakes on the road or around curves, but it’s far quieter than other brands I've used. All parts are quality materials. I’ve used this three-bike rack with three relatively heavy bikes on it, with no issues. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Capazzi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: At 20 pounds this is still heavy for me, but it's just over half the weight of the Thule that a friend loaned me. I like the quick release feature (use the key and turn the knob) because I'm free to run the compact SUV through the car wash if I can easily get the bike rack off. I was able to assemble it from the flat box in less than half an hour, even with an injured shoulder, and getting it on and off the vehicle should get easier with practice. Overall, a home run.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Expected better service from the product
customer_reviews.text: Very well engineered the bad is: the bands that secure the bikes in the cracles started breaking after my second use of the rack. The cradels also are showing extreme wear the ridges are almost worn smooth. I would hope that the company would stand behind their product and replace these defective parts. I have contacted customer service awaiting a response. WOW! Shortly I mean shortly after contacting customer service and Allen Co. and providing proof of purchase and explanation, they stood by their product and are replacing the bands. I am very appreciative of their service and understanding.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grider

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I think I researched this for three months :) I am very happy with my purchase. The price was just right and I am happy I bought this model specifically - the Premier. The lock was important for me. I don't want to bother with other locks. It looks great. It did not wiggle. I still didn't try it on 3 bikes but 2 worked great. Feel free to ask questions and I will answer if I can.
customer_reviews.author: EEFRAT

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good rack. Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good rack. Good, not amazing. However, they do give you a bunch of extras that cost way more with higher quality brands. So, if you just want to occasionally bring the bikes for family trips this is a winner. You can easily drop the bars down in the parking lot and you can drop the rack down to open the rear hatch. Recommend a good Ulock and some cable locks if you plan to leave the bikes for a bit anywhere while on the rack. Also, I strap the bikes together while driving to minimize swing and prevent damage to the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: xPJx

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to steal!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fact it folds out. My bikes fit well but shakes alot. It does not have a tight fit. But the locking feature does not keep it from being stolen and now I just have the keys because while i locked it to my car some one knew how to remove it and now its gone.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE HINKSON

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and it still works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago off amazon and it still works flawlessly!! I got bored and decided to review some old purchases. The biggest pro is the ability to lock this into the hitch so no one can steal it. Plus it pivots downward so I can still open the tailgate on my truck. For maximum security get a cable bike lock and lock the bikes to the carrier on your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a joke. Whoever welded it must have been drunk. It sits crooked in my hitch due to the poor weld job. Also wobbles like crazy even with the so called anti wobble bolt. Very poor workmanship. Gave it 1 star because you have to give it something to submit review. Try using a jig when you make these Allen. It might come out straighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an absolutely top notch bike carrier. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this bike carrier. It is quick and easy to install. The lower hitch pin at the base allows it to quickly fold back/outward to easily open my Subaru Crosstrek's back hatch. Easily pull the upper hitch pin and the bike support fork folds down to make it compact when not in use. Take a look at the photos to see how to handle mounting women's crusier style bikes and even full suspension bikes. This thing is great. I would highly recommend this to any biker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems solidly built for the price, a little wobbly side to side but no issues so far after multiple uses. I would recommend getting a hitch pin instead of having to use the provided bolt and nut each time taking the rack on and off, seems stupid not to include a pin but those are a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a well-made, heavy duty unit for the price. I bought this to put on the back of our new camper. I was really worried that the bicycles might not clear the spare tire, but they did so easily. The directions to put it together were very simple, I was a bit surprised how easily it all went together. The bicycles do sway a bit, but not enough to touch or damage the back of the camper. A simple bungee cord solved the sway issue. My next-door neighbor has a 4 bicycle unit that he paid three times the price for, and they’re almost identical. I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ThermalFluids

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, good (not great) rack
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's a really good rack. I agree with some of the complaints people have listed, but they're all things I can live with. My biggest complaint is the arms rocking when in the folding position. The sound resonates through my SUV, so I just turn the radio up :P For $110, it gets the job done. I only haul 2 bikes so I keep the center position open which eliminates any contact between the 2. I use velcro straps to secure the front wheels to the bike down tubes.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Great bike hitch, with funky screw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack for my car! Had a bit of trouble with the first one that was delivered, as the screw for adjusting the hitch size from 2in to 1in was stripped out. The new one worked, but the screw seems to require an oddly size Allen wrench that it doesn't come with. Other than that it's working great now, and if you have a normal 2 inch hitch on your car you won't need to remove the adapter anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Holds three bikes securely. My only wish is that I'd feel more secure with a rod through the hitch than a small spring loaded pin keeping the rack in the hitch. That may just be me being paranoid about the rack coming loose during a long trip. Traveled 1200 miles round trip and everything remained secure. My second wish would be a loop for the cable lock. Other than that, this rack is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph J. Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Shakes badly
customer_reviews.text: If you are only driving on paved roads this should be fine, but on anything rougher than that it shakes and sways badly. I even tried to tension it with tie down ratchet straps and it was allover the place, I have the 3 bike model and put two bikes on it spaced apart with a pool noodle in between them and they still chewed eachother up.
customer_reviews.author: Found your wallet

customer_reviews.title: Served us well on two long-distance trips so far
customer_reviews.text: We found this hitch rack to be a tad finicky to remove from the hitch, but it's pretty easy to install. I used a shim to dampen some of the rattle I noticed on the upright bar. It would be nice if the product automatically came with bungee cords and more build-in latch/hook points to secure bikes and wheels to the rack.
customer_reviews.author: amltrojan

customer_reviews.title: For the money, I believe it is a decent ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I believe it is a decent bike rack. However, my preference is to be able to mount carbon bikes (thus no frame interaction) and not to have to use bike top frame adaptors for some women's bikes. I'll keep it for another vehicle but I'm trying out a Yakima tray type bike rack because of the aforementioned need to leave the frames alone and have secure wheel mounting.
customer_reviews.author: HankRetiredEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Straps break all the time
customer_reviews.text: I've complained several times to the manufacturer about this product. The straps are terrible and break every time that I use them. The manufacturer gave me more straps but they broke too. I wish I could get something that works and hate that I've spent my hard earned money on something that puts my bikes in jeopardy and that can cause accidents for others behind me.
customer_reviews.author: trek

customer_reviews.title: Loose at hitch
customer_reviews.text: Installed this rack on my Subaru Forester 2020 with genuine hitch receiver. It turned out that "anti-wobble bolt" has too short shoulder to work properly. Thanks to JVK for his suggestion, I've added Hitch Tightener to the game and it fixed wobble issue. Another issue is that 3/8" lock nut seems to be as soft as butter. It's very easy to burr with a wrench. I'd suggest exercise caution and have a replacement nut ready. The rest of rack looks pretty good. Will test it soon on a long ride.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry M.

customer_reviews.title: happy with this
customer_reviews.text: A good product for this money. easy to put together, some reviews mentioned a wobble. Instead of using two wrenches to tighten the bolts I used a socket wrench, no wobble. I just travel around town to local trails so not sure about long haul 0r highway driving at a higher speed but i have no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: montanna1948

customer_reviews.title: Solid no wobble rack
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well built. Hold 3 bikes nicely. Master strap to keep everything held together. Overall, very nice rack. The hitch mechanism twists to tighten inside the hitch receiver, so no wobble or looseness. Then there's a key to lock it so the rack can't be taken out without the key. Very nice. Strong recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Olga S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I typically transport only 2 bikes but like the option of carrying a 3rd. I wanted to buy the largest option to fit my 1 1/4" receiver. It locks in securely to the receiver through an expanding action which also makes it stable and firm. It goes in and comes out easily although the lock feature can be a little fussy. I found that if you lock or unlock the knob and take the key out, as opposed to leaving it in, before turning that it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, will probably want anti wobble device also
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bike rack a few times now and it’s decent. It seems sturdy and holds the bikes in place as it should. The spacer to make it fit into a 2 inch hitch isn’t the best, the rack still moves around. A simple anti wobble u bar with a metal plate solved this problem, at a small extra cost, which is the reason for the missing star.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack for the Price !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Bike Rack for the price. Been looking for weeks and really can’t go wrong with this guy. Local Bike Shops would sell a lot more racks if they carried these, but Amazon makes it very easy... Had it built and on my car in less than 20 mins after it was delivered to my front door. Totally Recommend !
customer_reviews.author: K cup gal

customer_reviews.title: Big & Bouncy
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough and it's pretty heavy. Locks into my 1.25" receiver nice and tight. There is quite a bit of wobble and bounce ar the pivot joint, and it is put together correctly. That's with carrying 1 adult bike and 1 child's bike. Had to purchase an additional cross-bar attachment to carry my son's 18" bike becUse the frame was too small to fit over the rack arms. Seems they are only made for standard adult street bikes, and definitely not good for thick tube frame mountain bikes.
customer_reviews.author: beach guy

customer_reviews.title: A bit wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Fits my angled frame mountain bike. A little loose fitting in the receiver hitch making for a moderate amount of wobble. Luckily I can weld and added thickness to the portion going into the receiver which reduced the wobble. You could do the same thing by placing one or two strips of aluminum flashing into the receiver after inserting the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Beginning to rust
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, convenient to keep mounted. My one concern, after less than one month, showing signs of rust along the weld holding the carry arms in place. No wobble bolt works great for side to side steadying, but up and down still allows for bouncing. Use of bungee cords steadies the bikes vertically and keeps the wheels from spinning, as suggested by other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Door

customer_reviews.title: Premier Locking Quick Release
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so for this exact model this thing is built like a tank. Considering the price I didn’t have very many expectations but during the assembly process, I could instantly tell this thing was well made and I have no fear about having my $1,000 trek fastened to it securely. I will update my review after some good testing over this spring and summer but for initial quality assessment this thing is a solid reduction at a very good price. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: Our son recently grew into a bike without training wheels which made transporting all of our bikes difficult. This product has been a lifesaver. We are able to fit two adult bikes and one youth bike on here without any issues. We tried it once with three adults bikes and it worked great for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Randi Kempker

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Sway, Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. I have sued it numerous times and the amount of shake/wobble is very alarming. As you travel with your bikes, the sway generated by the movement of the vehicle and the weight of the bike is very concerning. It is very unsafe and you are worried the whole time you are using it. I eventually put it away and no longer use it. I purchased something that would not sway, a thule 970xt...much better product
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bike rack I have ever had so I was very excited! I love this thing! It is tight for three bikes but we are getting good at moving things around so they tuck right into each other. It was easy to put together. We did have problems with it moving around a lot when we moved it from the truck hitch to the car hitch.....guess what? User error! I found a You Tube video and found out I didn't have the right hole lined up in the hitch. We fixed it and the rack doesn't move at all! I am loving on this thing!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Like the review written by JVK, I added the hitch stabilizer to my 2 inch hitch (chevy equinox factory hitch) and now the rack is very secure. The hole for the larger anti wobble bolt in the rack was too small, I needed to drill the hole slightly larger for the bolt to seat correctly, but still needed the stabilizer to really make it secure. That is why I rated lower for assembly. Otherwise happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for what I needed. I have 2 boys 24” bikes and 1 adult female bike. I did buy a crossbar for my bike, to make it easier to attach, because it fits a little sideways without it. But it stayed secured with no issues on a trip with no bikes from Louisville to Chicago and fully loaded with all 3 bikes on the way back. There is a slight wiggle, but once the knob is turned and the key is locked, the rack isn’t going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bushen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rack Rack
customer_reviews.text: A great product. I really recommend this hitch rack very well made excellent quality. It’s very easy to assemble the bike straps secure your bikes perfectly. The rack stays firm in the hitch. I made a 3 days trip from San Francisco to Yosemite to Reno no issues at all. The only issue you may have is to set three bikes on the racks not enough space in between Besides that it’s a great product
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Don't carry three bikes and has few design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, but soon after few uses, the tie-down cradles get so loose that keep turning around, making the bike' securing process, difficult. The rack dimension is not compatible with a standard 2" hitch, so yes it wobbles. Even with some added material I use, still wobbles. I haven't figured out what combination of different bike frames it can handle, but so far you can just carry two bikes on this rack. No way you can carry three, unless the third one is tiny (for babies) bike. Will never spend money on this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: julio santiago

customer_reviews.title: Love my bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great when I traveled to the beach. The only way to attach the rack to your trailer hitch is with the bolt that is provided with the rack. Therefore, you cannot easily remove the rack when not in use. When I went to the beach, I had to drive around with it on my Chevy Equinox. I was still able to get in and out of my trunk because you can tilt the rack back when you need access to your trunk. I struggled with pulling out the pins to tilt it back, but once I figured out how to do it, it was much easier each time. Great purchase for what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Stutt

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike rack with lock
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to put on and take off the hitch. I wish the rack had three solid bars. With individual clasps on each side instead, makes it hard to load more than one bike by myself. I needed someone to hold the back of the bike while I secured the front.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: As long as you weld it on, it's an outstanding rack!
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well...if you are going to mount it permanently on your application. I have a Travel Trailer that has the receiver for a bike rack so I installed this rack, welded it in place...and TADA! This thing works great! It's easy to load the bikes on and off the rack. With it welded into the receiver, it's rock solid and does not rock around at all. Couldn't be happier with this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Aschwanden

customer_reviews.title: Solid built rack
customer_reviews.text: Unlike all the other reviews that said they had problems with it staying tight in a 2” hitch I didn’t have that problem. Once I tightened down the bolt that came with it I couldn’t get to to budge. The whole things is a very well built, solid rack for the price. I could see you have a wobbling problem if you used a typical receiver bolt and clip instead of the provided bolt and lock nut.
customer_reviews.author: jmiller

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack. Had to get a new one when I got rear ended and the rack took 100% of the damage and was still in fairly ok shape. The new one has straps like the old one but it does not conch as tightly. Also the top bars are actually angled up a bit more which is difficult to manage with a larger heavier bike but a bit more safe anyway. There is not locking mechanism except a loop at the base of the rack that I run a lock through which works just fine. All in all this is a great rack
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Strap buckle sewn in upside down
customer_reviews.text: This rack is nice enough for the most part, but one of the strap buckles was sewn in place upside down on the rack I received. This makes that strap completely useless, and I’ve had to use bungee cords to secure a bike on that spot. Big bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Rusting already!
customer_reviews.text: Design in concept is ok, but quality is rather poor...surprisingly poor. Most welds are crudely made, and there seems to be no primer or rust protection since rust is already showing through the very thin black paint. Very disappointing as this arrived just a few days ago!
customer_reviews.author: ABM

customer_reviews.title: Very good design and well built
customer_reviews.text: I have used it several times now. The rack fits well. It takes few minutes to install. No wobble, though I drive carefully on dirt tracks. I use bungee cords to tie bike tires together for better hold. This is must, else your bikes will hang loosely and can smash against the car. It also gives you more confidence while driving. I bought the Rhino cords which i use for several other things too. Only thing missing is the padding to prevent bike frame touching the rack and getting scratched. You can do it on your own or buy another model I think that has this padding.
customer_reviews.author: Yashwant Chauhan

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot in the hitch receiver. Otherwise no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: The bike rack moves a lot in the hitch receiver so whatever you are carrying does bounce around. We are using it to carry a wheelchair and just took a trip thru the smokey mountains. The bike rack held up very well except for just being a little loose in the 1 1/4 hitch receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford W. Gray

customer_reviews.title: IF this doesn't work for you, it's either product defect or user error
customer_reviews.text: Hitch Review: This is one of the best products I have ever bought - no wiggle if tightened properly per instructions; the straps work remarkably well though I do the recommended ratchet belt as well per instructions; excellent construction and great price. NO WOBBLE after 1300 mile trip! Easy rigging. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Avec Nourriture

customer_reviews.title: Have Bikes, Will Travel
customer_reviews.text: Not the 4-bike rack I originally wanted, since they were selling out, I purchased this one for traveling. It attached easily and securely to my hitch, solid, and very little movement of bikes while traveling. I'd recommend this rack to anyone looking for affordable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Deloge

customer_reviews.title: Plusses and minuses
customer_reviews.text: My initial impressions: The largest metal parts appear satisfyingly sturdy and well crafted. Oddly, no bolt is provided to secure it to a 2" hitch. That the installed rack wobbles is irritating and unsurprising. Most worrisome are the thin, flexible components through which the straps pass that secure the bike. These are critical components that appear extremely vulnerable to failure. I suppose I could be mistaken, but I simply do not believe that they would survive for very long. I am discouraged, but nonetheless resigned that something better might not be at hand or worth the wait or added expense.
customer_reviews.author: However bad things are, four more would make them that much worse

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Return Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an Amazon return (Used in good condition) The package was damaged and the item had small scratches on it. I saved a bunch of money and the cosmetics don’t concern me (It’s a bike rack) Great Product! Easy to assemble and fits our Jeep Wrangler perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: I think I’m a robot

customer_reviews.title: Great rack.
customer_reviews.text: This rack works well at a great price. I put some straps around the bikes to the rack and they stay rock solid. I've driven over a thousand miles without issue. The bolt system on the hitch isn't the best if you like to remove and install a hitch rack quickly. But it's secure. There are some mods other reviewers have made that are easy and solve the bolt issue.
customer_reviews.author: ritebuy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 3-bike carrier, but only carried 2 mountain bikes on a trip from MI to KY. The rack was easy to assemble and held the bikes securely with no issues throughout the trip. My mom hurt herself while we were in KY, and because of this Covid thing we weren't allowed to ride with her in the ambulance, but we were allowed to follow it. We were going 95 MPH for over a half hour on the interstate, then some erratic driving through the city to the hospital. Not a single issue with the bikes or carrier (& mom has recovered and is well).
customer_reviews.author: Very Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Requires additional purchases to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Comes with the filler bar attached, so that it fits a 2" hitch. Intentionally bought this product because it fits the 1.25" as well. Impossible to remove the filler bar without the correct size security screw, which was not included for whatever reason... The rack itself seems to be built out of quality materials and is very easy to use. However, there is no way to lock it to the car without an additional purchase and it wobbles a lot, Going to need to buy a stabilization/locking device for it definitely... Mainly just really annoyed that taking off the filler bar required a trip to the hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: PBL

customer_reviews.title: Great design...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy design and easy to take on/off. I have a Porcshe SUV and I’m OCD about scratches it doesn’t touch the car at any point. I use a flexion exercise band to wrap around the part of the bike frame that rest against the Allen frame to prevent any scratches to bike from vibration when driving...
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal I Could Find
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it does for half the price as the others. 5 Stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 1 1/4 inch hitch and holds two mountain bikes
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I use this to transport our mountain bikes to various trails and it works well. We have a Mercury Mariner which has a 1 1/4 inch hitch and this fits it perfectly. The adapter the comes on it can make it so that it also fits a 2inch hitch. Seems like a brilliant idea to me. The only complaint I have about this item would be the fact that the restraints for the bike are only straps like you would have on a back pack. They make me kind of nervous traveling down the highway, but I imagine they are fine. We haven't had any problems as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: satisfied at this price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the locking version which may be different from the other reviews. I have a class II 1 1/4 receiver and no issues with the connection. I do note some wobble coming from the quick release (the part that lowers for your hatch/tailgate. There's definitely play there, but I have everything bungied up as well as with the strap and seems secure. I actually notice it more without the bikes on. PS. like in other reviews, there is difficulty in fitting some bikes in this rack depending on their frame and suspension. My sons dual suspension 16 inch frame will not fit this rack
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works well, solid feeling construction
customer_reviews.text: Works well, solid feeling construction. I have used it for more than a year now and it is still like new. It can be difficult to get 3 bikes on there but 2 bikes is easy. I use the bolt on hitch bolt that it came with and only remove it during winter. It comes with an adapter for use in a 2 inch hitch as well but I only test fit it (it fit) yet I have not driven around with it on a 2 inch hitch.
customer_reviews.author: mek

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with kids and women’s bikes
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to do. There is still a little sway with my 2 inch hitch. I’m easily able to attach a women’s and kids bike without an adapter bar - something that our bike partners cannot do with their Thule rack.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Mc

customer_reviews.title: Worst bike rack ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst bike rack ever! We bought it only because the Thule rack we had in order was back ordered for 4 months. We needed a bike rack for a cross country trip from NH to MT. By the time we got to MT the bikes were ruined from rubbing on each other. My husband bike almost has a whole through his specialized stump jumper frame. I would never buy another Allen product. I wished we wouldn’t have “needed” a bike rack so bad.
customer_reviews.author: stacyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack if you have a trailer hitch on your car. The add-on sleeve that converts from 1 1/4" to 2" hitch size is a nice idea and allows us to use the rack on both cars. The engineering of this rack is unique allowing for tailgate on Subaru Outback to open with the rack attached, easy to put the bikes on and take them off and the straps make securing our bikes very easy. We are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sam P

customer_reviews.title: Frame come corroded !!
customer_reviews.text: The main frame come corroded. DO NOT FEEL SAFE to use. Wondering it it is new ? The corrosion is not happening overnight. The paint is gone and corrosion could get worse. The clearance at Hitch seems bigger that i expected. wobbling when bikes were loaded. Can not believe ALLEN is sending this to customer.
customer_reviews.author: Wen Xu

customer_reviews.title: Distance between bikes insufficient to avoid damaging bikes.
customer_reviews.text: All your bikes will be scrapped all to hell after first use. Takes 20 years off the bike! Insufficient space. Absolutely regretting this purchase! I spent a lot on these bikes and now they look awful.
customer_reviews.author: ioji

customer_reviews.title: Love my bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike rack! I’m an older lady just getting into biking and I can easily put my bike on and off. I did have my son put on the hitch and show me how everything works. Its great. I can now go meet my friends at all the local parks😀
customer_reviews.author: keprmom

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike rack. Solid construction, does what it is supposed to do and holds bikes! :) One issue I have with this product is that the bolt becomes permanent. I would have really like to have been sent a bolt that was easier to remove and replace. Not a huge issue, but an irritant. Expect that you need to buy a couple other things when you get this. You need better tie downs for the bikes, and while this has a bolt that comes with it, you may want something that makes the rack easier to take off if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not for mountain bikes or cars with spare tire in the back of the car
customer_reviews.text: The rack looks nice. Folds, tilts and locks. Little loose and wabbly. I jad to return the item because it was touching my spare tire in the back of my van. Because of the tire and not enough space on the rack I wouldn’t be able to put 3 bikes on it. But the most important thing is that I don’t fit my mountain bike on it. I have a specialized stumpjumper and there was no way to put the bike on the rack. Would work for you if you have a bar that you attach to the bike to hhok it on the rack or having a roadbike with simple frame. And no spare tire in the way.
customer_reviews.author: tomas kosco

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have seen the very beefy carriers that almost seem like overkill and very expensive. I doubt I would try a cross country trip with three heavy bikes on this carrier but maybe I could. For shorter trips and carrying one or two bikes it is a great deal. Compared to the price of other big name carriers if all you are after is getting a couple of bikes to the trailhead within a hundred miles or so then this is really all you need. Bikes tie down easy with the great straps. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Terrell L.

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike rack for the money and takes care of all my needs. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because Amazon said it wouldn't fit my 2016 Toyota Tacoma, which it does. I didn't realize this until after I made the purchase, but it fits fine. The other reason is that the need some sort of provision to stabilize the bike from swinging and keep the front wheel from turning back and forth. It's no big deal; nothing that a couple of bungee cords can't take care of. Other than that, it's a great rack. You can get it assembled in about 10 minutes and you're ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that I had to go to such lengths to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that as stolen off my car. It is the same brand, same bike configuration but the length that connects into my hitch was 1/2 inch too long and the holes did not line up. Thankfully we have the tools to shave off the end so it would fit. I was disappointed that I had to go to such lengths to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Thinking it through

customer_reviews.title: Unable to tighten rack on a 2” hitch after only using it for a month
customer_reviews.text: Within 1 month if usage tightening the rack doesn't work.. i used my key and rotated the screw but it does nothing.. earlier it used to tighten.. there is no support video on what to do in this case nor a return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Allen Sports 3 bike hitch leans to the right.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Allen Sports bike rack for my XB and it works great and is square to the car when attached to the hitch. This review is for the second bike rack I bought for my son's Sonata. The bike rack is not square and level. It leans to the right when attached to the hitch. Apparently whoever welded the bike rack didn't get the mounting bar square to the receiver bar.
customer_reviews.author: Rik

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This rack is a great value at less than $100 bucks. I like the rubber adjustable straps and curved adjustable grips that hold the bike in place and protect the bike's finish. It's mount is a bit wobbly on my SUV, the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars, but most of these things are wobbly, even the expensive ones. You can buy third-party solutions for that. It's very strong and can hold up to 3 bikes. I recommend this bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: Rene E. Borroto

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase have used regularly. no trouble with bike movement during our travels. Bikes secure. We are usually traveling with two bikes but could fit three easily. they secure properly with no movement. Highly recommend this 3 bike mount to others. We read about issues others had but we find by securing bikes as instructed no difficulties have been experienced. We traveled 3 hours with bikes on the rack and have done numerous short trips since purchase. Happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D n B bikers

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot.  Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great value for the price, but then opening the trunk is a hassle. You have to pull a pin out. It's got a sharp wire that pokes you everytime. It is always shaky, makes so much noise. It serves it's purpose. The bolt on it is not your standard size. The money I saved here, I spent on tools to put it on. Not really happy, would not recommend. If I were to do it again, I would buy one of the used nicer ones that is easy for my lift gate to open.
customer_reviews.author: Buysalot

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3 bikes.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Took about 30 minutes to assemble. Really like the tilt away feature for better access to the hatchback on my Hyundai Ionic. Also like that I can use it on different receivers.
customer_reviews.author: mtymouse

customer_reviews.title: Great 3-bike hitch rack
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a hitch rack for my SUV. Narrowed down to Allen brand after researching other brands and reaching numerous reviews. Assembly was easy. It took me 30 minutes to assemble and install it on my car. I was able to put two adults and one junior bike on it without any issues. I found enough gap between the rack and my car's back door so that the handle of first bike doesn't touch the car. I didn't see a strap to secure the bikes. I used one of my bungie cords to wrap around the bikes to avoid bikes from falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Ashutosh Khanna

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the overprices brands - THIS ONE IS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Why anyone would spend $300, $400, $500 for expensive brands like Thule or Yakima is beyond me. This rack assembled in about 10 minutes, and setup in another 5. Solid construction, high quality thick rubber straps. You get all the features of a premium rack - fold down for gate access, bike mount fold down, up to 2" hitch mount. Solid product. So glad I didn't buy a used one on craiglist.
customer_reviews.author: CGC

product_meta.title: Allen Sports 3-Bike Hitch Racks for 1 1/4 in. and 2 in. Hitch
feature_bullets: 3 bike rack fits vehicles with either a 1.25 or 2 inch trailer hitch
16 inch long carry arms individually secure bicycles with Allen's patented tie down system
Folding carry arms quickly drop out of the way when rack is not in use
Rack sets up and installs in less than 5 minutes
Sturdy steel construction with black powder coat finish; Lifetime warranty
Allen's warranty does not cover items purchased through third-party sellers
